s.text: The LAT front-pager on the meeting is somewhat less upbeat, referring to its "futility" and describing President Clinton as "conspicuously subdued and visibly unhappy."

The New York Times leads with President Clinton's statement yesterday at the Moscow summit that he would support further U.S. aid if Russia presses on with economic reforms, a message the paper says he also made in private talks with Boris Yeltsin and prominent communist politicians.
The Post adds that the White House figured being grilled about Monica at the summit might be politically useful, in that this could make reporters appear unpatriotic.
